member.summary: Resumes after a required fields dialog returns (in case of the rich and Facebook retrievers). Resumes after a location retriever dialog returns or an edit favorite location dialog returns (in case of the favorite retriever).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address
member.summary: An address can contain the following fields: address line, locality, neighborhood, admin district, admin district 2, formatted address, postal code and country or region.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address.Unit
member.summary: Unit Number

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address.AddressLine
member.summary: The official street line of an address relative to the area, as specified by the Locality, or PostalCode, properties. Typical use of this element would be to provide a street address or any official address.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address.AdminDistrict
member.summary: A string specifying the subdivision name in the country or region for an address. This element is typically treated as the first order administrative subdivision, but in some cases it is the second, third, or fourth order subdivision in a country, dependency, or region.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address.AdminDistrict2
member.summary: A string specifying the subdivision name in the country or region for an address. This element is used when there is another level of subdivision information for a location, such as the county.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address.CountryRegion
member.summary: A string specifying the country or region name of an address.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address.FormattedAddress
member.summary: A string specifying the complete address. This address may not include the country or region.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address.Locality
member.summary: A string specifying the populated place for the address. This typically refers to a city, but may refer to a suburb or a neighborhood in certain countries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Address.PostalCode
member.summary: A string specifying the post code, postal code, or ZIP Code of an address.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.GeocodePoint
member.summary: Represents a geo point.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.GeocodePoint.Coordinates
member.summary: List of the coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.GeocodePoint.CalculationMethod
member.summary: The method that was used to compute the geocode point.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.GeocodePoint.UsageTypes
member.summary: The best use for the geocode point.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.GeocodePoint.HasCoordinates
member.summary: Returns whether point has geo coordinates or not.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location
member.summary: Represents the location returned from the Bing Geo Spatial API: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff701725.aspx

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.LocationType
member.summary: The location type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.BoundaryBox
member.summary: A geographic area that contains the location. A bounding box contains SouthLatitude, WestLongitude, NorthLatitude, and EastLongitude values in units of degrees.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.Name
member.summary: The name of the resource.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.Point
member.summary: The latitude and longitude coordinates of the location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.Address
member.summary: The postal address for the location. An address can contain AddressLine, Neighborhood, Locality, AdminDistrict, AdminDistrict2, CountryRegion, CountryRegionIso2, PostalCode, FormattedAddress, and Landmark fields.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.Confidence
member.summary: The level of confidence that the geocoded location result is a match. Use this value with the match code to determine for more complete information about the match.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.EntityType
member.summary: The classification of the geographic entity returned, such as Address. For a list of entity types, see Location and Area Types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.GeocodePoints
member.summary: A collection of geocoded points that differ in how they were calculated and their suggested use. For a description of the points in this collection, see the Geocode Point Fields section below.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.Location.MatchCodes
member.summary: One or more match code values that represent the geocoding level for each location in the response.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.LocationSet
member.summary: Represents a set of locations returned by the

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.LocationSet.EstimatedTotal
member.summary: The total estimated results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Bing.LocationSet.Locations
member.summary: The location list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.GeocodingResponse.Results
member.summary: Gets or sets the results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.GeocodingResponse.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets the status.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.GeocodingResult.AddressComponents
member.summary: Gets or sets the address_components.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.GeocodingResult.Geometry
member.summary: Gets or sets the geometry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.GeocodingResult.Types
member.summary: Gets or sets the types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.street_address
member.summary: indicates a precise street address

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.route
member.summary: indicates a named route (such as "US 101").

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.intersection
member.summary: indicates a major intersection, usually of two major roads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.political
member.summary: indicates a political entity. Usually, this type indicates a polygon of some civil administration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.country
member.summary: indicates the national political entity, and is typically the highest order type returned by the Geocoder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.administrative_area_level_1
member.summary: indicates a first-order civil entity below the country level. Within the United States, these administrative levels are states. Not all nations exhibit these administrative levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.administrative_area_level_2
member.summary: indicates a second-order civil entity below the country level. Within the United States, these administrative levels are counties. Not all nations exhibit these administrative levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.administrative_area_level_3
member.summary: indicates a third-order civil entity below the country level. This type indicates a minor civil division. Not all nations exhibit these administrative levels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.colloquial_area
member.summary: indicates a commonly-used alternative name for the entity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.locality
member.summary: indicates an incorporated city or town political entity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.sublocality
member.summary: indicates an first-order civil entity below a locality

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.neighborhood
member.summary: indicates a named neighborhood

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.premise
member.summary: indicates a named location, usually a building or collection of buildings with a common name

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.subpremise
member.summary: indicates a first-order entity below a named location, usually a singular building within a collection of buildings with a common name

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.postal_code
member.summary: indicates a postal code as used to address postal mail within the country.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.natural_feature
member.summary: indicates a prominent natural feature.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.airport
member.summary: indicates an airport.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.park
member.summary: indicates a named park.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.point_of_interest
member.summary: indicates a named point of interest. Typically, these "POI"s are prominent local entities that don't easily fit in another category such as "Empire State Building" or "Statue of Liberty."

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.post_box
member.summary: indicates a specific postal box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.street_number
member.summary: indicates the precise street number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.floor
member.summary: indicates the floor of a building address.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Google.Models.AddressType.room
member.summary: indicates the room of a building address.

member.summary: Checks whether the given location is one of the favorite locations of the user inferred from the bot data.

member.summary: Checks whether the given string is the name of one of the favorite locations of the user inferred from the bot data.

member.summary: Looks up the favorite location at the given zero-based index value for the user inferred from the bot data.
member.returns: >A favorite location or null if no favorite location can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.IFavoritesManager.GetFavoriteByName(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.Internals.IBotData,System.String)
member.summary: Looks up the favorite location with the given name value for the user inferred from the bot data.
member.returns: >A favorite location or null if no favorite location can be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.IFavoritesManager.GetFavorites(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.Internals.IBotData)
member.summary: Looks up the favorite locations value for the user inferred from the bot data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.IFavoritesManager.Add(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.Internals.IBotData,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Dialogs.FavoriteLocation)
member.summary: Adds the given location to the favorites of the user inferred from the bot data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.IFavoritesManager.Delete(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.Internals.IBotData,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Dialogs.FavoriteLocation)
member.summary: Deletes the given location from the favorites of the user inferred from the bot data.
member.param: The favorite location value to be deleted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.IFavoritesManager.Update(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.Internals.IBotData,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Dialogs.FavoriteLocation,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Dialogs.FavoriteLocation)
member.summary: Updates the favorites of the user inferred from the bot data. The favorite location whose value matched the given current value is updated to the given new value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationOptions
member.summary: Options for customizing

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationOptions.None
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationOptions.UseNativeControl
member.summary: Some of the channels (e.g. Facebook) has a built in location widget. Use this option to indicate if you want the LocationDialog to use it when available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationOptions.ReverseGeocode
member.summary: Use this option if you want the location dialog to reverse lookup geo-coordinates before returning. This can be useful if you depend on the channel location service or native control to get user location but still want the control to return to you a full address.
member.remarks: Due to the accuracy limitations of reverse geo-coders, we only use it to capture , , , and

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationOptions.SkipFavorites
member.summary: Use this option if you do not want the LocationDialog to offer keeping track of the user's favorite locations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationOptions.SkipFinalConfirmation
member.summary: Use this option if you want the location dialog to skip the final confirmation before returning the location

member.name: T:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationDialog
member.summary:
Represents a dialog that handles retrieving a location from the user.
This dialog provides a location picker conversational UI (CUI) control, powered by Bing's Geo-spatial API and Places Graph, to make the process of getting the user's location easy and consistent across all messaging channels supported by bot framework.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationDialog.IsRootDialog
member.summary: Determines whether this is the root dialog or not.
member.remarks: This is used to determine how the dialog should handle special commands such as reset.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationDialog.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationOptions,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationRequiredFields,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationResourceManager)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The prompt posted to the user when dialog starts.
The location options used to customize the experience.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationDialog.#ctor(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Dialogs.ILocationDialogFactory,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.IFavoritesManager,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationResourceManager)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationDialog.StartAsync(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.IDialogContext)
member.summary: Starts the dialog.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.LocationDialog.ResumeAfterChildDialogInternalAsync(Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.IDialogContext,Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Dialogs.IAwaitable{Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Dialogs.LocationDialogResponse})
member.summary: Resumes after: 1- Any of the location retriever dialogs returns. Or 2- The add to favoritesDialog returns.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Resources.Strings.HelpMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Say or type a valid address when asked, and I will try to find it using Bing. You can provide the full address information (street no. / name, city, region, postal/zip code, country) or a part of it. If you want to change the address, say or type 'reset'. Finally, say or type 'cancel' to exit without providing an address..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Bot.Builder.Location.Resources.Strings.InvalidFavoriteLocationSelection
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Sorry, "{0}” does not match a favorite location. Type or say a number/name to use a favorite location or type “other” to create a new location. Type or say “edit” or “delete” number/name to change a favorite. Say “cancel” to exit..
